subject: Communication
title: The Avoider's Trap
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Avoider's Trap usable.

hook.text: She ignored the problem for months, hoping it would resolve itself. It didn't.

buildup.text: Conflict avoidance feels peaceful in the short term, but research shows it compounds problems exponentially.

discovery.text: Avoided conflicts don't disappear. They go underground â€” emerging as passive aggression, gossip, or sudden explosions.

twist.text: Avoidance is the most common conflict style globally. Entire cultures prize harmony so highly that problems fester.

climax.text: The cost of avoidance is always higher than the cost of early intervention. Small conversations prevent big crises.

punchline.text: Avoiding conflict doesn't keep the peace. It delays the war.

quiz.question: What happens to avoided conflicts over time?
options: They compound and emerge as bigger problems
